alert.note: Alert for Beckham; Custer; Washita (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 11:48PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Washita, southwestern Custer and northeastern Beckham Counties through 1215 AM CDT... At 1148 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles south of Elk City, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Elk City, Burns Flat, Canute, and Foss. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 33 and 53. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
